post_text:
A message from the Bloom Trail High School Administration:

We want to inform the community that yesterday evening, well the close of the school day, we acted on a vague anonymous tip regarding a bomb threat by evacuating the school of all students involved in extracurricular activities. Upon a prompt and thorough investigation by the Steger Police Department, the tip was determined to be unfounded.

As always, school safety remains our number one concern and we appreciate the Steger Police Department’s help in investigating this matter. We also appreciate our families’ support and concern.
text:
A message from the Bloom Trail High School Administration:

We want to inform the community that yesterday evening, well the close of the school day, we acted on a vague anonymous tip regarding a bomb threat by evacuating the school of all students involved in extracurricular activities. Upon a prompt and thorough investigation by the Steger Police Department, the tip was determined to be unfounded.

As always, school safety remains our number one concern and we appreciate the Steger Police Department’s help in investigating this matter. We also appreciate our families’ support and concern.

post_text:
Nathaly Ruiz is the Bloom High School Student of the Month for September for the Chicago Heights Rotary Club!

Nathaly is a sophomore, a member of Scholastic Bowl, and Mathletes. She enjoys her Pre-Calculus class the most, and is planning on attending college. She is undecided on her major, however she is considering teaching.

She received her award on Thursday September 21 at the Rotary Club meeting. Please congratulate her on her award!

Nathaly is a sophomore, a member of Scholastic Bowl, and Mathletes. She enjoys her Pre-Calculus class the most, and is planning on attending college. She is undecided on her major, however she is considering teaching.

She received her award on Thursday September 21 at the Rotary Club meeting. Please congratulate her on her award!

post_text:
Recent news has revealed that Melanie Valencia, a Bloom High School sophomore, has died. The Bloom Township High School District 206 family is deeply saddened to lose Melanie and our thoughts and prayers are with her family during this troubling time. Our students are our world and Melanie was a special part of that world. We will miss her dearly.

If there are any students and staff in need of assistance processing this difficult news have been advised to speak with our counseling office. Counselors and social workers are on hand all day to provide assistance we we all work through this tragic news.
text:
Recent news has revealed that Melanie Valencia, a Bloom High School sophomore, has died. The Bloom Township High School District 206 family is deeply saddened to lose Melanie and our thoughts and prayers are with her family during this troubling time. Our students are our world and Melanie was a special part of that world. We will miss her dearly.

If there are any students and staff in need of assistance processing this difficult news have been advised to speak with our counseling office. Counselors and social workers are on hand all day to provide assistance we we all work through this tragic news.

On January 24th the Bloom Trail physics students participated in the 2017 Bridge Building Competition that took place at ITT Chicago.

post_text:
Esmeralda Portillo is the Bloom High School Student of the Month for the Rotary Club of Chicago Heights.

Esmeralda is a sophomore at Bloom. She enjoys her Pre Calculus class the most. Outside of school she enjoys doing community service with her church, playing volleyball, and is on the Bloom Township softball team. She is thinking of going to college to pursue a career in criminal justice or law enforcement. She received her award at the Rotary Club meeting on Thursday December 1.

Please congratulate Esmeralda on her award!
text:
Esmeralda Portillo is the Bloom High School Student of the Month for the Rotary Club of Chicago Heights.

Esmeralda is a sophomore at Bloom. She enjoys her Pre Calculus class the most. Outside of school she enjoys doing community service with her church, playing volleyball, and is on the Bloom Township softball team. She is thinking of going to college to pursue a career in criminal justice or law enforcement. She received her award at the Rotary Club meeting on Thursday December 1.

Please congratulate Esmeralda on her award!

post_text:
Caitlyn Nardi is the Bloom Trial High School student of the month for December by the Chicago Heights Rotary Club!

Her teachers admire her hard work, respectful attitude, and being a team player. Caitlyn has a quiet focus and dedication to her work, her ability to be articulate about difficult concepts and texts, her sensitivity to the nuances within literature, and her passion for reading, writing, and creative expression, both in and out of the classroom.

Congratulations Caitlyn!
text:
Caitlyn Nardi is the Bloom Trial High School student of the month for December by the Chicago Heights Rotary Club!

Her teachers admire her hard work, respectful attitude, and being a team player. Caitlyn has a quiet focus and dedication to her work, her ability to be articulate about difficult concepts and texts, her sensitivity to the nuances within literature, and her passion for reading, writing, and creative expression, both in and out of the classroom.

Congratulations Caitlyn!

post_text: Bloom student Garesia Woods recently received Sheriff Thomas J. Dart's Youth Medal of Honor Program. The award was established to recognize Cook County youth that volunteered a minimum of 100 hours of service during the previous year. Awesome job, Garesia!
text: Bloom student Garesia Woods recently received Sheriff Thomas J. Dart's Youth Medal of Honor Program. The award was established to recognize Cook County youth that volunteered a minimum of 100 hours of service during the previous year. Awesome job, Garesia!

post_text:
Alert from Bloom Trail High School:

This morning we received a phone call from a parent at 9:10 a.m., the start of 2nd period, stating her daughter had texted her that she saw a student display something that resembled a weapon. We immediately went into a lockdown, and conducted a thorough investigation while all students were safely secured in their 2nd hour classes. The investigation resulted in the recovery of a BB gun. The lockdown was lifted at approximately 10:30 a.m. and we have returned to a normal schedule. We are appreciative that we received this tip and we ask you to encourage your students, as always, to share any information they have that will help us continue to keep our school safe.
text:
Alert from Bloom Trail High School:

This morning we received a phone call from a parent at 9:10 a.m., the start of 2nd period, stating her daughter had texted her that she saw a student display something that resembled a weapon. We immediately went into a lockdown, and conducted a thorough investigation while all students were safely secured in their 2nd hour classes. The investigation resulted in the recovery of a BB gun. The lockdown was lifted at approximately 10:30 a.m. and we have returned to a normal schedule. We are appreciative that we received this tip and we ask you to encourage your students, as always, to share any information they have that will help us continue to keep our school safe.

post_text:
Sydney Schluntz is the Bloom High School Chicago Heights Rotary Club Student of the Month for September. She received her award at the Rotary Club meeting on September 8. Sydney is a Junior at Bloom. Her favorite classes are History and Art. She participates in the Literary Magazine, and the Tech Crew. She plans on going to college or an art school to study visual art with the possibility of becoming a tattoo artist.
Please congratulate her on her award.

post_text:
ATTENTION BLOOM TRAIL PARENTS!

We would like to invite you to the first Bloom Trail Parent Co-Op meeting of the year! If you are looking to become more involved in our school and in your child’s education please join us at 6:00pm tonight (Tuesday, September 6th) in the Bloom Trail Library.

The parent co-op has a variety of opportunities available and we are always welcoming of new members and new fresh ideas to make Bloom Trail a better place for everyone in the community. So, please join us for our kick-off to the school year! We have raffles and refreshments to add to the fun!
text:
ATTENTION BLOOM TRAIL PARENTS!

We would like to invite you to the first Bloom Trail Parent Co-Op meeting of the year! If you are looking to become more involved in our school and in your child’s education please join us at 6:00pm tonight (Tuesday, September 6th) in the Bloom Trail Library.

The parent co-op has a variety of opportunities available and we are always welcoming of new members and new fresh ideas to make Bloom Trail a better place for everyone in the community. So, please join us for our kick-off to the school year! We have raffles and refreshments to add to the fun!

post_text:
The Bloom counseling office is hosting a financial aid information night on September 14th at 6:00 in the library. This will be an informational session and overview for parents where they will be able to review the financial aid process involved with filling out the forms.

La oficina de consejería estará ofreciendo un taller de ayuda financiera el 14 de septiembre a las 6:00 en la biblioteca. Esta será una reunión informativa para los padres dónde podrán ver el proceso de completar la solicitud gratuita de ayuda federal para estudiantes.

post_text: Great to see good work being done in support of Chicago Heights and Ford Heights children!
shared_text:
Mary Compton is with Scott Reese.
August 27, 2016 at 6:54 AM ·

Thank you to my church, Trinity Lutheran in Tinley Park for donating 35 back packs to Urban Ministry Christ Cares led by Scott Reese. Kids in Ford Heights and Chicago Heights with no back packs or school supplies were able to go to school with new back packs and supplies. Thanks Trinity!
